noun.description: An official agreement intended to resolve a dispute or conflict.
examples: unions succeeded in reaching a pay settlement
the settlement of the Sino-Japanese war

noun.description: A place, typically one that has hitherto been uninhabited, where people establish a community.
An arrangement whereby property passes to a succession of people as dictated by the settlor.
The action or process of settling an account.
Subsidence of the ground or a structure built on it.
examples: a boundary wall, which has cracked due to settlement, is to be replaced
